results.title: Web3 People Operations Coordinator
results.description:

We are a fully remote company with no fixed headquarters. As a distributed company, we embrace a diverse and inclusive culture that transcends geographical borders. Our team members come from all over the world and bring a rich array of experiences, perspectives, and lifestyles to the team. We believe that this diversity enhances our creativity, collaboration, and innovation, and enables us to deliver outstanding products and services to our customers.

We are deeply committed to fostering a culture of empathy, integrity, strategic thinking, innovation, leadership, and performance. These values drive everything we do, from the way we interact with our customers and partners, to the way we develop and deliver our products and services. It's our shared values that give us the strength and drive to become the open metaverse for collectors.

What‚Äôs in It for You?

  • Be a vital member of a cutting-edge project and take your career to the next level.
  • Work from anywhere, on your own schedule, and be part of a team that shares your values and has a clear vision.
  • Have the chance to shape the future of an innovative new model for cryptocurrency and blockchain applications.
  • Get hands-on experience with the latest tech and systems, and challenge yourself to learn and grow.
  • Play an active role in one of the most significant technological innovations in human history.
  • Be compensated with a competitive salary paid in crypto for your dedication and efforts.

Your Impact

In this role, you will have the opportunity to get involved in all aspects of People Operations and will play a crucial role in supporting the growth and development of the organization.

The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills, a proactive and hands-on approach, attention to detail, and a passion for learning about and staying up-to-date on the latest trends in Web3 and NFTs. This is a part-time role with the potential to transition to a full-time position in the future. If you are a motivated and organized individual with a keen interest in the intersection of technology and HR, this could be the perfect opportunity for you.

As a People Operations Coordinator, your responsibilities will include:

  • Developing and continuously improving HR policies and processes, including tools/systems and operational guides.
  • Taking ownership of employee queries and using critical thinking to identify and resolve root causes.

  • Managing semi-monthly and monthly payrolls accurately and efficiently.

Requirements

  • 3+ years of experience in People Operations, with a track record of success in supporting and scaling HR and Recruiting functions and processes.
  • A demonstrated passion for staying at the forefront of technology and innovation, with a minimum of 1 year of experience in a Web3 or start-up company.
  • Excellent English language skills, both written and verbal.
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships with employees at all levels of the organization.
  • A proactive, "can-do" attitude and a willingness to take on new challenges.
  • Experience working with high-performing teams and a track record of contributing to team success.
  • A tech-savvy mindset and attention to detail, with the ability to navigate and adapt to new systems and tools.
  • The ability to handle sensitive and critical information, conversations, and situations with compassion and discretion.

Discover more about ClubRare and what we stand for by visiting our website at www.clubrare.xyz


We are committed to creating a work environment that is inclusive and welcoming to all. As an equal-opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or any other characteristic. results.title: Global Corporate Recruiter
results.description:
Spacewell is hiring an enthusiastic Global Corporate Recruiter. Your local office will be located at Wilrijk (Antwerp) and you will be in charge of the recruitment for the Netherlands, Belgium, France and Sweden.

A day on the job

  • 8.45 AM: You open your computer and check your mailbox. You received 5 new CVs from potential candidates that applied on our LinkedIn post. What a great start of this day!
  • 9 AM: You review all the CVs to have a good idea of the potential candidates. After doing a deep dive and taking into account the requirements, you narrow your pipeline to 3 candidates.
  • 9:30 AM: You call these 3 potential candidates one by one to do a phone screening and invite them for a HR interview to get to know them better.
  • 11.00 AM: You reach out to your French colleagues to discuss a new vacancy description and priorities. Afterwards you will publish the vacancy on relevant channels.
  • Noon: Lunch time!
  • 1 PM: You have your weekly HR meeting with our colleagues from The Netherlands to get up to date on the latest HR changes and HR strategy.
  • 14:30 PM: You are meeting an interesting candidate for the open position within sales. Afterwards you reach out to the hiring manager to share your feedback and discuss the next steps. ¬†
  • 4 PM: ¬†You have a call with our colleagues in Sweden to ask some urgent questions regarding the format of a new contract and check the local regulations.

Furthermore, as Global Corporate Recruiter you will also contribute to innovative recruitment strategies and critically observe the job market. Next to that, thinking creatively about which resources and channels would make our recruitment a success, is definitely a must have. You will be the center of the entire recruitment journey and experience, ¬†starting from the creation of international vacancy descriptions to the onboarding of new employees.

What about the team?

As a Global Corporate Recruiter, you are the point of contact within the HR team for the recruitment journey from A to Z. You will recruit for different countries, which includes the Netherlands, Belgium, France and Sweden. Together with your international HR team, you will tackle topics like employee administration, implementation of an HRIS, recruitment, onboarding, retention, learning & development, CSR, vitality, a diverse range of legal topics‚Ä¶

Could this be you?

  • You have at least 4 years of working experience as a recruiter.
  • You have a broad knowledge about a diverse range of labour markets, employment communication and innovative recruitment strategies.
  • You work independently, effectively, plan systematically and take initiative.
  • You are communicative and have a positive can-do attitude.
  • Since you will be responsible for international recruitment, you are fluent in Dutch, English and French.
  • You are a people person. You enjoy being part of a team and sharing the information you come across. This also means you know how and when to maintain confidentiality.

The challenges we see in this role

  • Spacewell is a company in full transition. At times this results in organized chaos. However, we stand together as a team to make sense of what's going on and to find meaning in each situation.
  • You're willing to learn, as you will carry out a diverse range of tasks for multiple regions. By linking different pieces of information together, you're easily able to get an idea of the bigger picture and to put things into perspective.
  • You're not afraid to speak up in case you have questions. You have a sense of responsibility and ownership, so that you know when to escalate (potential) issues, when to treat information in a confidential way.

How do we make this a win-win?

  • You get to be a part of an innovative, dynamic and warm team of colleagues with different backgrounds and reference frameworks. This allows you to learn a lot and challenge yourself to creatively shape the recruitment journey. Your colleagues understand your challenges,¬† will help you along the way and appreciate your hard work.
  • Spacewell promises continuous impact combined with an energetic workplace.
  • It is our mission to optimize building performances and improve the quality of life by delivering innovative software solutions on an international scale.
  • We strive to have a wider impact as an organization by being bold and ambitious. Next to that, all of our tools are linked to insights based on real data.
  • Next to the flexible work hours and remote working possibilities, you will get a salary and fringe benefits in line with your experience.

What would next steps look like?

  1. You reach out to our recruitment team to send in your CV or to ask some further questions.
  2. You will be invited for a digital cup of coffee.
  3. Depending on locations and schedules, you will meet up with your future colleagues at our offices or virtually.

results.title: Human Resources Business Partner Lead
results.description:
Company Description
Since we opened our doors in 2009, the world of commerce has evolved immensely, and so has Square. After enabling anyone to take payments and never miss a sale, we saw sellers stymied by disparate, outmoded products and tools that wouldn‚Äôt work together.

To solve this problem, we expanded into software and built integrated solutions to help sellers sell online, manage inventory, book appointments, engage loyal buyers, and hire and pay staff. Across it all, we‚Äôve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale, so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow in one place. Afterpay furthers our goal to provide omnichannel tools that unlock meaningful value and growth, enabling sellers to capture the next generation shopper, increase order sizes, and compete at a larger scale.

Today, we are a partner to sellers of all sizes ‚Äì large, enterprise-scale businesses with complex operations, sellers just starting, as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers grow, so do our solutions. There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We‚Äôre building a significant, meaningful, and lasting business, and we are helping sellers worldwide do the same.

Job Description

Our HR Business Partners (HRBP) support specific teams, working closely with management and employees on people-related issues: talent management, employee relations, coaching/development, compensation, conflict and performance management, organizational development and more. HRBPs are instrumental in initiating and driving HR programs and initiatives within specific functions.

We‚Äôre looking for a HRBP Lead to drive people and business initiatives across Square. You are someone who is interested in making a significant impact in our Customer Success organization and excels in a fast-paced, high engagement environment with extraordinary desire to innovate. You will work closely with business leaders to provide hands-on and strategic input, insight, and advice with respect to employee relations, performance management, coaching, compensation, conflict management, organizational development, training and more. You‚Äôre comfortable speaking up and driving initiatives forward despite any unexpected roadblocks. You will report to Square's HR Lead.¬†¬†

As part of the Host Healthcare Recruitment team, the Senior Recruiter drives successful placements of clinicians on assignment across multiple healthcare specialties and clients. Senior Recruiters develop strong relationships with clinicians nationwide through proactive outreach efforts to recruit and place them in open temporary job opportunities aligned with their clinical and specialty experience across health systems, acute care hospitals, outpatient clinics, home health organizations and more.

The successful Senior Recruiter is self-motivated, with a strong desire to meet or exceed placement goals and passion for helping clinicians to thrive in their careers. The recruiter is a creative, energetic individual with excellent interpersonal communication skills and professional demeanor and maturity. The Senior Recruiter maintains a positive outlook and serves as a positive influence within the team. He or she is also well-organized, comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, and exhibits Host‚Äôs core values of Team Strength, Personal Accountability, Leading with Integrity, Driven by Excellence, Embracing Positivity and Mastering Our Craft.


Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Consistently meets and/or exceeds sales goals by driving new placements and retention of clinicians on assignment.

results.title: Human Resources Consultant
results.description:
Company Description

Are you ready to join the Greater team?

Greater Human Capital (Greater) is a team of passionate and skilled consultants, dedicated to delivering outstanding experiences for people and organizations.

We are seeking candidates to join our team as a Human Resources (HR) Consultant. The HR Consultant is responsible for partnering with our clients to design and deliver HR policies, procedures and programs, as well as managing associated projects and change management. The ideal candidate is passionate about solving complex challenges in a dynamic environment and brings an entrepreneurial spirit to their work with clients and beyond.

This position is part-time, with the opportunity to expand to full-time, and fully remote (based in the United States), and will not require any office duties or travel during the COVID-19 pandemic.



Job Description

What you‚Äôll do as an HR Consultant:

  • Serve our clients as a thought partner and advisor, guiding strategic planning and service delivery efforts around HR and people and culture-related priorities, strategies and initiatives.
  • Spearhead the design and implementation of full-cycle, cross-cutting HR solutions in areas such as: recruiting and onboarding, benefits and compensation administration and design, performance management, employee engagement, training and development, and employee communications.
  • Act as an external HR project manager by creating project plans, mobilizing client resources, managing timelines, and proactively identifying issues or obstacles to mitigate risk and enable efficiency.
  • Provide leadership and guidance on HR matters related to federal, state, and local compliance.
  • Support other HR or people and culture-related projects, services, needs as requested by our clients.
  • Contribute to Greater‚Äôs firm and brand development through communications, culture building, process improvements and other thought leadership efforts.



Qualifications

We are committed to an inclusive hiring process. If you feel you would be a strong fit for the role, we encourage you to apply even if you do not meet all the criteria listed below.¬†

The nitty gritty:

  • 2-4 years of relevant experience (HR consulting, HR generalist, or HR business partner preferred)
  • Minimum of 1 year of external consulting experience or other client-facing experience
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree required; advanced degree in related specialization area preferred
  • Demonstrated interest in HR profession through certifications (PHR/SPHR/SHRM-CP/SHRM-SCP), coursework, professional organizations, conference attendance, etc.
  • Proficiency with HRIS and ATS systems; Workday and ADP proficiency preferred
  • Proficiency with business productivity software (GSuite, Microsoft Office, Slack) and comfort with human resources systems and platform technologies
  • Strong communication skills (oral and written), including the ability to create presentations/decks for external consumption and present complex information eloquently for variety of external stakeholders

The big picture:

  • Desire to be part of a high-performing and flexible team
  • Comfortable working independently in a fast-paced and flexible startup environment
  • Strong client and service delivery orientation; ability to manage multiple projects and client engagements at the same time
  • Comfortable with ambiguity and rolling up sleeves to solve problems creatively
  • Ability to maintain personal effectiveness from home and remain positively motivated under pressure
  • Strong research capabilities and project management skills
  • Successful record of building and maintaining trusted relationships with clients across the spectrum of seniority; ability to build relationships virtually (Zoom, Slack, over the phone, etc.)
  • Ability to gather, synthesize and analyze quantitative and qualitative data from stakeholder interviews, focus groups, employee surveys, or other sources

  • Strong sense of professional ethics and accountability

  • Greater Together:¬†We‚Äôre inclusive and reflective, and we believe in the power of diverse teams.¬†

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Greater is absolutely and unequivocally committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion in all aspects of our practice. We strive to build and sustain a diverse team and strongly encourage applications from candidates of color.¬†

Greater is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will receive consideration for employment, without regard to race, color, religion, creed, national origin, gender or gender-identity, age, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, pregnancy or parental status, or any other basis prohibited by law and our core values.

We expect applicants to have a solid knowledge of various HR functions and administrative responsibilities. Under limited supervision, the HR Recruiter Specialist provides support in functional areas of Human Resources which include recruitment, onboarding, personnel records, regulatory reporting requirements, benefits administration and other areas as needed. This is a fully remote position that would be working with existing and recruiting new team members in the United States, South Africa, the Philippines, and other countries.

This would be a good fit for someone who:

‚Ä¢ Is humble, motivated, and emotionally intelligent, specifically with a high degree of empathy.

‚Ä¢ Enjoys helping others succeed and sees their role as maximizing the output of their team.

‚Ä¢ Loves a faster-paced, no-drama environment where office politics, backstabbing, gossip, and negativity are not tolerated.

‚Ä¢ Is extremely detail-oriented and appreciates people who take an organized, systematic approach to achieving success.

‚Ä¢ Likes the idea of working for a smaller but growing company where their ideas and contributions directly impact the company‚Äôs success, direction, and growth.

‚Ä¢ Is a quick, self-motivated learner who wants to work for a company that will invest in their education.

‚Ä¢ Wants a position that will offer upward earning and career advancement; we want people who are interested in growth, learning, and becoming part of our team long-term.

Hours:
This is a full-time position of 40 hours a week. The expectation is that the majority of your hours worked would be Monday through Friday, 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM Pacific Time to collaborate with our team. However, hours will have some flexibility to conduct interviews with job candidates in various time zones.

Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Identifies and implements efficient and effective recruiting methods and strategies based on the available role, industry standards, and the needs of the organization.

‚Ä¢ Manage job posting and advertisement processes.

‚Ä¢ Attends and participates in online job fairs and recruiting events.

‚Ä¢ Maintain organizational charts and detailed job descriptions along with salary records

‚Ä¢ Screens applications and selects qualified candidates.

‚Ä¢ Prepare and distribute assessments and numerical, language, and logical reasoning test.

‚Ä¢ Schedules interviews, oversees preparation of interview questions, and other hiring and selection materials.

‚Ä¢ Update employee records with new hire information and/or changes in employment status.

‚Ä¢ Implement training and development plans as part of new team member onboarding.

‚Ä¢ Performs employee onboarding to include data entry into the HR Information system and new employee orientation. Ensures data entered is complete and accurate and provides guidance to employees ensuring they have a thorough understanding of company policies and procedures.

‚Ä¢ Assists in creating and updating the employee handbook.

‚Ä¢ Ensures compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and company policies.

‚Ä¢ Performs other duties as assigned.

Requirements

‚Ä¢ Excellent spoken and written English communication skills.

‚Ä¢ Successful work experience as a Human Resources Specialist, officer, recruiter, administrator, or other HR position

‚Ä¢ Strong working knowledge of HR functions and procedures (e.g., pay and benefits, recruitment, training, and development)

‚Ä¢ Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite, using Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS), and LinkedIn Recruiter

‚Ä¢ In-depth knowledge of or willingness to learn hiring strategies, labor laws, and employment diversity, equity, and inclusivity.

‚Ä¢ Commitment to staying current on the understanding of labor laws and disciplinary procedures.

‚Ä¢ Proficient with or the ability to quickly learn applicant-tracking software or other recruitment systems.

‚Ä¢ Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills.

‚Ä¢ Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

‚Ä¢ Ability to create and implement sourcing strategies for recruitment for a variety of roles.

‚Ä¢ Proactive and independent with the ability to take initiative.

‚Ä¢ Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with laws, regulations, and best practices applicable to hiring and recruitment.

‚Ä¢ Aptitude for critical thinking, problem-solving, and decision making.

‚Ä¢ Strength of character, ethics, commitment, reliability, and integrity.

Education & Experience:
Minimum of three (3) years of related work experience in HR, or a higher education degree and one (1) year of related work experience in Human Resources.

Physical Requirements:

¬†

Their duties include hiring and interviewing staff, administering compensation and benefits, and serving as a resource for US based staff, overseeing performance management and managing and leveraging full capabilities of our HRIS systems (e.g. Rippling, 15Five).

  • Develops and updates human resource policies to ensure a compliant and positive work environment and experience for employees.
  • Works with the Director of Human Resources to implement, monitor and improve upon culture and professional development initiatives.
